item.title: Salesforce wants to do for agentic AI what they did for SaaS
item.content:encoded: Christophe Coenraets, SVP of Developer Relations at Salesforce, tells Eira and Ben about building the new Salesforce Developer Edition, which includes access to the company’s agentic AI platform, Agentforce. Christophe explains how they solicited and incorporated feedback from the developer community in building the developer edition, what types of AI agents people are building, and the critical importance of guardrails and prompt engineering.

item.title: Whether AI is a bubble or revolution, how does software survive?
item.content:encoded: Money is pouring into the AI industry. Will software survive the disruption it causes?

item.title: Is the enterprise (actually) ready for AI?
item.content:encoded: Maryam Ashoori, Head of Product for watsonx.ai at IBM, joins Ryan and Eira to talk about the complexity of enterprise AI, the role of governance, the AI skill gap among developers, how AI coding tools impact developer productivity, what chain-of-thought reasoning entails, and what observability and monitoring look like for AI.

item.title: Next-level observability: live breakpoint debugging
item.content:encoded: On this episode, Ryan chats with Henrik Rexed, Cloud Native Advocate at Dynatrace, about debugging cloud-based applications like you would a local app.

item.title: Beyond speed: Measuring engineering success by impact, not velocity
item.content:encoded: If velocity is just a tool and not a goal, how do you measure real success for engineering teams?

item.title: Using AI to find patient zero in marketing campaigns
item.content:encoded: Ben Popper chats with CTO Abby Kearns about how Alembic is using composite AI and lessons learned from contract tracing and epidemiology to help companies map customer journeys and understand the ROI of their marketing spend. Ben and Abby also talk about where open-source models have the edge and the challenges startups face in building trust with big companies and securing the resources they need to grow.

item.title: Best practices for third-party data acquisition: powering AI context
item.content:encoded: This post explores crucial lessons learned in the trenches of data licensing, drawing insights from Stack Overflow and the growing importance of socially responsible data practices in a changing internet landscape.

item.title: A new look for what’s next
item.content:encoded: The world has changed a lot since Stack Overflow started. It's time for our brand to change with it.

item.title: Moving beyond velocity: Measuring real business impact
item.content:encoded: How can engineering teams move beyond traditional metrics like velocity to create real business impact?

item.title: Behind the scenes: Community “management” at Stack Overflow
item.content:encoded: Community “management” at its core is supporting and enabling communities to manage themselves.

item.title: Mastering microservices with a former Uber and Netflix architect
item.content:encoded: Ryan welcomes Jeu George, cofounder and CEO of Orkes, to the show for a conversation about microservices orchestration. They talk through the evolution of microservices, the role of orchestration tools, and the importance of reliability in distributed systems. Their discussion also touches on the transition from open-source solutions to managed services, integration opportunities for AI agents, and the future of microservices in cloud computing.

item.title: The consensus is TypeScript is the easiest way to build on blockchain
item.content:encoded: You might already be familiar with the programming language best suited to building on blockchains.

item.title: Improving on a 30-year-old hardware architecture
item.content:encoded: At HumanX 2025, Ryan chatted with Rodrigo Liang, cofounder and CEO of SambaNova, about reimagining 30-year-old hardware architecture for the AI era.

item.title: Without foundational governance, every AI deployment is a liability in disguise: Q&A with Jack Berkowitz of Securiti
item.content:encoded: Avoiding bad data is just as important in AI; it can open you to fines, lawsuits, and lost customers.

item.title: “We’re not replacing you; we’re with you”: Where AI meets infrastructure
item.content:encoded: Ryan talks with Greg Fallon, CEO of Geminus, about the intersection of AI and physical infrastructure, the evolution of simulation technology, the role of synthetic data in machine learning, and the importance of building trust in AI systems. Their conversation also touches on automation, security concerns inherent in AI-driven infrastructure, and AI’s potential to revolutionize how complex infrastructure systems are managed.

item.title: Banking on innovation: Engineering excellence in regulated financial services
item.content:encoded: Financial institutions face a balancing act between tech innovation and strict regulations. As customer expectations for improved user experience and demands from those tasked with enhancing features keep rising, engineering teams need to find a harmonious middle ground.

item.title: How self-supervised language revolutionized natural language processing and gen AI
item.content:encoded: Self-supervised learning is a key advancement that revolutionized natural language processing and generative AI. Here’s how it works and two examples of how it is used to train language models.

item.title: Grab bag! On the floor at HumanX
item.content:encoded: Today’s episode is a roundup of spontaneous, on-the-ground conversations from HumanX 2025, featuring guests from CodeConductor, DDN, Cloudflare, and Galileo.

item.title: Standardization and simplification as key to engineering excellence
item.content:encoded: In this episode of Leaders of Code, we chat with guests from Lloyds Banking Group about their focus on engineering excellence and the need for organizations to adapt to new technologies while ensuring customer safety and meeting their expectations.

item.title: Community Products roadmap update, April 2025
item.content:encoded: An update on recent launches and the upcoming roadmap

item.title: Visually orchestrating data diagnostics but platform agnostic
item.content:encoded: Ryan chats with Dataiku CEO and cofounder Florian Douetteau about the complexities of the genAI data stack and how his company is orchestrating it.

item.title: Generating components, not tokens
item.content:encoded: On today’s episode, Ben and Ryan chat with Laly Bar-Ilan, Chief Scientist at Bit.

item.title: Wait, what is agentic AI?
item.content:encoded: Is “agentic AI” just a buzzword, or is it the sea change it seems?

item.title: Engineering teams need to adapt to AI’s scaling challenges
item.content:encoded: AI is not a linear process. To scale effectively, engineering leaders must account for varied edge cases, presenting a new set of challenges.

item.title: WBIT #7: Exploring WebAssembly with the first SO user to get 10k rep
item.content:encoded: Kyle interviews Michael Stum, a former Stacker who started (and returned) to answering questions on the community site.

item.title: Smarter insights, stronger teams: New features for Stack Overflow for Teams
item.content:encoded: 2025.3 | Teams Enterprise Release

item.title: How AI can prevent clinician burnout
item.content:encoded: In today’s episode, Ryan sits down with Richard “Spencer” Schaefer, cofounder and CTO of Lunar Analytics and a federal AI officer, and Caroline Zhang, cofounder and CTO of Knowtex, which provides AI-powered voice technology to automate workflows. They talk about safeguarding patient privacy, how AI changes doctor-patient interactions and healthcare delivery, the challenges inherent in rolling out AI technology, and the importance of quality data to fuel AI initiatives. Also included: a chat with Jeff Berkowitz, cofounder and CEO of Delve Deep Learning.

item.title: Like self-driving cars, fully AI-automated sysadmins don't exist
item.content:encoded: As with cars, there are few system administration tasks that involve little to no automation.

item.title: How do you fact-check an AI?
item.content:encoded: Ryan chats with Amr Awadallah, founder and CEO of GenAI platform Vectara about how retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) has advanced, why fact-checking and accurate data are essential in building AI applications, and how Vectara’s Mockingbird model seeks to minimize hallucinations.

item.title: “There is a real cost to moving fast”: Using AI to accelerate drug discovery
item.content:encoded: On this episode of Leaders of Code, Maureen Makes, VP of Engineering at Recursion, discusses AI's role in drug discovery, scaling and integration challenges, and the importance of innovation in achieving the high standards desired.

item.title: WBIT #6: Be curious, ask questions, and don’t argue with JavaScript
item.content:encoded: Kyle chats with Jesse Tomchak a software engineer at ClickUp about all the spicy backend takes they could find.

item.title: Bottom of the first: A veteran VC’s take on the AI landscape
item.content:encoded: Ryan welcomes Tomasz Tunguz of Theory Ventures back to the podcast to talk about the intersection of AI and venture capital, the implications of AI on the labor market, and the future of AI applications.

item.title: Open-source AI: Are younger developers leading the way?
item.content:encoded: In March, over 1,000 developers and technologists gave us insights into what they think about open source and the role it plays with AI.

item.title: Using GenAI as a learning tool, not a crutch
item.content:encoded: AI is changing how we think about coding. While tools evolve, critical thinking, problem-solving, and creativity remain the essential skills for top developers.

item.title: Is AI a bubble or a revolution? The answer is yes.
item.content:encoded: At HumanX 2025, Ryan sat down with HumanX CEO Stefan Weitz and Crunchbase CEO Jager McConnell to talk about where the money is in the AI space, where most enterprise AI strategies fall short, how companies can build business models when AI tech is evolving so quickly, and why this is AI’s microservices moment.

item.title: From training to inference: The new role of web data in LLMs
item.content:encoded: Data has always been key to LLM success, but it's becoming key to inference-time performance as well.

item.title: Not all AI is generative: Efficient scheduling with mathematics
item.content:encoded: Efficiently solving a complex scheduling problem using simulated annealing.

item.title: Boots on the ground: Holistic AI and Audioshake at HumanX
item.content:encoded: Two interviews for the price of one, direct from HumanX 2025! Ryan sits down with Raj Patel, AI transformation lead at Holistic AI, and then chats with Audioshake cofounder and CEO Jessica Powell.

item.title: “Are AI agents ready for the enterprise?”
item.content:encoded: Deepak Singh, VP of Developer Agents and Experiences at AWS, helps Ryan break down the hype around agentic AI in software development. They cover the definition and real-world functionality of AI agents, how developers can integrate them into existing workflows, and the importance of establishing guardrails to ensure trust and security in agentic AI.

item.title: AI is shifting focus from syntax to critical thinking
item.content:encoded: In this episode of Leaders of Code, host Ben Popper, Stack Overflow CEO Prashanth Chandrasekar, and GitLab Field CTO Lee Faus explore how GenAI is reshaping software development practices.
